TopicTitle: Got as far as unity but then... HELP ME/TUTORIAL PLZ

Articles.Content:
following this tutorial http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25040 (which is for an older version)

I got to the part with exporting the part to a .mu , (though I had forgotten to uv wrap the thing anyways), THERE WAS NO SCRIPT TO DRAG ON TO AN OBJECT SO I COULD EXPORT,

Yes, I did import the v 0.20 unity package that allows the export, then got the 0.23 update folders..... but the scripts that are there, they are in a folder called "editor" which I couldn't drag without "this script is in the editor folder, you can not put this on a gameobject" (or something like that)...

HELP... :confused::confused:

your HELP... will be apreciated by this discouraged -mod newb- greatly.

I posted it here, since the tutorial section is well, in the gameplay category, and this is the closest place after that.
this should be moved to a different thread.

this should be moved to a different thread.

well, this is a thread, so that's technically not possible.

if you mean different sub-forum (which you obviously do), then the obvious choices were : general-gameplay question- tutorials ....or.... addons-addon development..

this is not a GAMEPLAY thread, so why should it be moved to gameplay tutorial ?

it is about addon development, there simply isn't a tutorial section in there.

Click on the parent GameObject in your Hierarchy tab (default left)

Click on [Add Component] in the Inspector tab (default right) then select KSP > Part Tools

The [Part Tools (Script)] component should appear in the Inspector tab

Enter your desired KSP output information in the new [Part Tools (Script)] component

Press the [Part Tools (Script)] > [Write] to output

-----------------

For the 0.23 part tools update, you need to navigate to your project directory (by default (under Windows)this will be in your Documents directory, C:\Users\[Username]\Documents\[UnityProjectName])

Copy the PartTools folder from the PartTools023.zip to the Assets subdirectory of you Unity Project directory (there should already be a PartTools there from the 0.20 package, overwrite all conflicts to update).

Edited March 5, 2014 by NoMrBond

ok, guess the do the "add component" worked, i'm really used to (in unity) having the drag n drop, like in the tutorial and I made a habit out of it, since I've used unity prior to the add component button.. (who remembers tornado twins being the only tutorial and island demo being the latest tech ?).
